title: Where to file 'satisfaction of judgment' in LA county?
question: Hi, i'm confused to find which county clerk/recorder's office to visit if i have a 'safisfaction of judgement' document from the creditor to submit to.
answers: This question is a bit confusing because the creditor usually should be filing the satisfaction of judgement. Nevertheless, call the main number on the court's website and have your case number handy. They will be able to direct you to the right department.
It should be filed at the courthouse where the judgment was entered. (The caption of the document you have--i.e., look at the top half--should have the name of the court branch/location.)

Look at the case number on the document. The Satisfaction of Judgment should be filed in the court where the judgment was entered. If the judgment was entered in Los Angeles County, go the the court's website and input the case number. It will tell you where the court is located.

If there is an Abstract of Judgment recorded, you may want to get a certified copy of the Satisfaction of Judgment and record it with the County Recorder in the county where the Abstract was recorded.
